Package uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.alloc.db

Class DatabaseEngine.Connection

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.alloc.db.UncheckedConnection
uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.alloc.db.DatabaseEngine.Connection
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable, Connection, Wrapper
Enclosing class:
DatabaseEngine
public final class DatabaseEngine.Connection
extends UncheckedConnection
Connections made by the database engine bean. Its methods do not throw checked exceptions. The connection is thread-bound, and will be cleaned up correctly when the thread exits (ideal for thread pools).

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from interface java.sql.Connection

    TRANSACTION_NONE, TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED, TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED, TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ, TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE

  • Method Details

    • transaction

      public void transaction​(boolean lockForWriting, DatabaseEngine.Transacted operation)
      A nestable transaction runner. If the operation completes normally (and this isn't a nested use), the transaction commits. If an exception is thrown, the transaction is rolled back.
      Parameters:
      lockForWriting - Whether to lock for writing. Multiple read locks can be held at once, but only one write lock. Locks cannot be upgraded (because that causes deadlocks).
      operation - The operation to run
      See Also:
      transaction(DatabaseEngine.TransactedWithResult)

    • transaction

      public void transaction​(DatabaseEngine.Transacted operation)
      A nestable transaction runner. If the operation completes normally (and this isn't a nested use), the transaction commits. If an exception is thrown, the transaction is rolled back. This uses a write lock.
      Parameters:
      operation - The operation to run
      See Also:
      transaction(DatabaseEngine.TransactedWithResult)

    • transaction

      public <T> T transaction​(DatabaseEngine.TransactedWithResult<T> operation)
      A nestable transaction runner. If the operation completes normally (and this isn't a nested use), the transaction commits. If an exception is thrown, the transaction is rolled back. This uses a write lock.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the result of operation
      Parameters:
      operation - The operation to run
      Returns:
      the value returned by operation
      See Also:
      transaction(DatabaseEngine.Transacted)

    • transaction

      public <T> T transaction​(boolean lockForWriting, DatabaseEngine.TransactedWithResult<T> operation)
      A nestable transaction runner. If the operation completes normally (and this isn't a nested use), the transaction commits. If an exception is thrown, the transaction is rolled back.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the result of operation
      Parameters:
      lockForWriting - Whether to lock for writing. Multiple read locks can be held at once, but only one write lock. Locks cannot be upgraded (because that causes deadlocks).
      operation - The operation to run
      Returns:
      the value returned by operation
      See Also:
      transaction(DatabaseEngine.Transacted)

    • query

      public DatabaseEngine.Query query​(String sql)
      Create a new query. Usage pattern: 
       try (Query q = conn.query(SQL_SELECT)) {
     for (Row row : u.call(argument1, argument2)) {
         // Do something with the row
     }
 }
      or: 
       try (Query q = conn.query(SQL_SELECT)) {
     u.call(argument1, argument2).forEach(row -> {
         // Do something with the row
     });
 }
      Parameters:
      sql - The SQL of the query.
      Returns:
      The query object.
      See Also:
      query(Resource), update(String), SQLQueries

    • query

      public DatabaseEngine.Query query​(String sql, boolean lockType)
      Create a new query. Usage pattern: 
       try (Query q = conn.query(SQL_SELECT)) {
     for (Row row : u.call(argument1, argument2)) {
         // Do something with the row
     }
 }
      or: 
       try (Query q = conn.query(SQL_SELECT)) {
     u.call(argument1, argument2).forEach(row -> {
         // Do something with the row
     });
 }
      Parameters:
      sql - The SQL of the query.
      lockType - Whether we expect to have a write lock. This is vital
      Returns:
      The query object.
      See Also:
      query(Resource), update(String), SQLQueries

    • query

      public DatabaseEngine.Query query​(Resource sqlResource)
      Create a new query. 
       try (Query q = conn.query(sqlSelectResource)) {
     for (Row row : u.call(argument1, argument2)) {
         // Do something with the row
     }
 }
      or: 
       try (Query q = conn.query(sqlSelectResource)) {
     u.call(argument1, argument2).forEach(row -> {
         // Do something with the row
     });
 }
      Parameters:
      sqlResource - Reference to the SQL of the query.
      Returns:
      The query object.
      See Also:
      query(String), update(Resource), SQLQueries

    • query

      public DatabaseEngine.Query query​(Resource sqlResource, boolean lockType)
      Create a new query. 
       try (Query q = conn.query(sqlSelectResource)) {
     for (Row row : u.call(argument1, argument2)) {
         // Do something with the row
     }
 }
      or: 
       try (Query q = conn.query(sqlSelectResource)) {
     u.call(argument1, argument2).forEach(row -> {
         // Do something with the row
     });
 }
      Parameters:
      sqlResource - Reference to the SQL of the query.
      lockType - Whether we expect to have a write lock. This is vital only when the query is an UPDATE RETURNING.
      Returns:
      The query object.
      See Also:
      query(String), update(Resource), SQLQueries

    • update

      public DatabaseEngine.Update update​(String sql)
      Create a new update. Usage pattern: 
       try (Update u = conn.update(SQL_UPDATE)) {
     int numRows = u.call(argument1, argument2);
 }
      or: 
       try (Update u = conn.update(SQL_INSERT)) {
     for (Integer key : u.keys(argument1, argument2)) {
         // Do something with the key
     }
 }
      or even: 
       try (Update u = conn.update(SQL_INSERT)) {
     u.key(argument1, argument2).ifPresent(key -> {
         // Do something with the key
     });
 }

      Note: If you use a RETURNING clause then you should use a DatabaseEngine.Query with the lockType set to true.

      Parameters:
      sql - The SQL of the update.
      Returns:
      The update object.
      See Also:
      update(Resource), query(String), SQLQueries

    • update

      public DatabaseEngine.Update update​(Resource sqlResource)
      Create a new update. 
       try (Update u = conn.update(sqlUpdateResource)) {
     int numRows = u.call(argument1, argument2);
 }
      or: 
       try (Update u = conn.update(sqlInsertResource)) {
     for (Integer key : u.keys(argument1, argument2)) {
         // Do something with the key
     }
 }
      or even: 
       try (Update u = conn.update(sqlInsertResource)) {
     u.key(argument1, argument2).ifPresent(key -> {
         // Do something with the key
     });
 }

      Note: If you use a RETURNING clause then you should use a DatabaseEngine.Query with the lockType set to true.

      Parameters:
      sqlResource - Reference to the SQL of the update.
      Returns:
      The update object.
      See Also:
      update(String), query(Resource), SQLQueries

    • exec

      public void exec​(String sql)
      Run some SQL where the result is of no interest.
      Parameters:
      sql - The SQL to run. Probably DDL. This may contain multiple statements.
      See Also:
      query(String), update(String)

    • exec

      public void exec​(Resource sqlResource)
      Run some SQL where the result is of no interest.
      Parameters:
      sqlResource - Reference to the SQL to run. Probably DDL. This may contain multiple statements.
      See Also:
      query(Resource), update(Resource)
